boon.name: Boon of Fontaine
entries: If you are a devotee of Fontaine, spending at least one week performing {@variantrule Downtime Activity: Religious Service|XGE} at this holy site grants you the boon of Fontaine.

As an action, you may spend the Boon of Fontaine to manifest a 5 ft. diameter stone pillar out of any rock or stone floor. The pillar can rise up to 20 ft. high and can lift a medium creature. If the creature is unwilling, it may make a DC 12 Dexterity Saving Throw, landing harmlessly on an unoccupied square adjacent to the pillar. If the pillar would collide with the ceiling or crush an item on it against another surface, it immediately crumbles to dust and disappears.
The pillar crumbles to dust and disappears after ten minutes.

condition.name: Abhorrence
entries: A creature with Abhorrence has been subjected to the unknowable. It could be forbidden lore from eldritch tomes, the psyche of an aberration, or visions of the far plane. An effect can give a creature one or more levels of Abhorrence.

At the start of their turn, a creature with Abhorrence must make a Wisdom saving throw, the DC is 10 plus the level of Abhorrence they have. On a success, they reduce their Abhorrence by 1. On a failure, the DM rolls a {@dice d10} or picks one effect from the table below. The effect lasts until the start of the creature's next turn.
Outside of initiative, a character with Abhorrence making an ability check must also make a save against Abhorrence.

rows: The character is assailed by alien concepts and is {@condition Paralyzed}. The effect ends if the creature takes any damage.

The character becomes suddenly attached to the nearest creature. They must use their action to {@action Grapple} the creature, and will not relinquish the grapple willingly until the start of their next turn.
The character is {@condition Blinded} by visions of a dark majesty too beautiful to comprehend.
The character is {@condition Deafened} by a cacophony of extra-stellar winds that howl in their ears.
The character becomes {@condition Frightened} by all creatures around them. They must spend their action dashing as far away from any creatures as they can.
The character sees that which reviles them most in their hands. They immediately throw everything they are holding at least 10 ft. away from them.

The character sees hostile aberrations in the folding layers of reality around them. They are unable to tell friend from foe and must spend their turn attacking the nearest creature, whether it is friend or foe.
The character is Silenced as if by the {@spell Silence} spell.
The character immediately drinks one potion from their inventory or, if they have no potions, uses one spell scroll.
The character falls asleep. They are {@condition Unconscious} until damaged or shaken awake by another character.

entries: If an already abhorred creature suffers another effect that causes abhorrence, its current level of abhorrence increases by the amount specified in the effect's description.
An effect that removes abhorrence reduces its level as specified in the effect's description, with all abhorrence effects ending if a creature's abhorrence level is reduced below 1.
Creatures lose all stacks of Abhorrence when they complete a short or long rest.

cult.name: Cult Imperator - Incipio Branch
entries: The Incipio branch focuses on contacting powerful aberrations and either dominating them to their purposes or entering in arrangements with them in exchange for power. They are more likely to contain warlocks amongst their midst and seek out the forgotten horrors of the world.

entries.name: Unknowable
entries: The cultist is shielded from telepathy, scrying, and mind reading.

entries.name: Unknowable (1/SR)
entries: As a bonus action, the cultist telepathically whispers forbidden lore into the mind of one target. The target gains 3 {@condition Abhorrence|GuildOfIcons}.

spell.name: Thunderwall

components.m: a sheep's bladder and a piece of reed

entries: You create a wall of vibrating noise on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is transparent and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature that can hear within its area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the wall, landing {@condition prone}, or half as much damage on a successful save and are not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
A creature that enters the wall or ends their turn inside the wall must repeat the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

item.name: Sec-Tacles
entries: These glasses contain lenses cut from a temporal crystal that telepathically senses the wearer's wants.

As an action, you speak aloud a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity in the room or area you are currently in that occurred within the last 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply. That reply is based only on visual information available at the time and through your natural abilities that work based on sight, such as darkvision. If you could not have seen the event from where you are standing, the answer is inconclusive.
Once used, this item can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Crafting the sec-tacles.
entries: Before you can craft the sec-tactles, the formula must be discovered using five pieces of lore related to the item found through {@variantrule Downtime Activity: Research|XGE}.

items.name: Tools.
entries: You must have proficiency in Tinkers Tools or Arcana.

items.name: Materials.
entries: 2,000 GP and one temporal crystal shard.

items.name: Time.
entries: 10 workweeks.

item.name: Owl
entries: A thick pearlescent liquid coats the walls of this bottle, leaving transparent feather-like traces as it drains to the bottom. It smells of earth after rain.
Using an action to drink this potion grants the drinker the potion's High.
When the High effect ends, you must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to avoid the effects of the potion's Low.

entries.name: High.
entries: You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Low.
entries: You have disadvantage on all Strength checks saving throws for one day. Your bones feel brittle - as if they are hollow.
The effects of this potion's Low can be ended early through the spells {@spell Lesser Restoration}, {@spell Greater Restoration}, {@spell Heal}, or {@spell Wish}.

entries.name: Crafting Owl.
entries: Crafting one bottle of Owl requires

items.name: Tools.
entries: You must have proficiency in Alchemist's Supplies.

items.name: Materials.
entries: 1,000 GP of alchemical ingredients and the tail feather of a {@creature Roc|MM}.

items.name: Time.
entries: 1 workweek.

item.name: Spark
entries: A silver powder that crackles with sparks of electricity that bounce off the glass container. The bottle smells faintly of ozone and the powder tingles on the tongue.
Using an action to drink this potion grants the drinker the potion's High.
When the High effect ends, you must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw to avoid the effects of the potion's Low.

entries.name: High.
entries: You gain resistance to Lightning damage and your movement speed is increased by 10 ft. for one hour.

entries.name: Low.
entries: Your movement speed is halved for one day. Your skin prickles with static electricity.
The effects of this potion's Low can be ended early through the spells {@spell Lesser Restoration}, {@spell Greater Restoration}, {@spell Heal}, or {@spell Wish}.

entries.name: Crafting Spark.
entries: Crafting one bottle of Spark requires

items.name: Tools.
entries: You must have proficiency in Alchemist's Supplies.

items.name: Materials.
entries: 1,000 GP of alchemical ingredients and 4 oz. of powdered dragon horn taken from a {@creature young blue dragon|MM}.

items.name: Time.
entries: 1 workweek.

item.name: Berserk
entries: This appears to be a bottle of blood, but holding it, you can feel a faint vibration emanating from the liquid inside. The smell of it is iron and ichor and hatred.
Using an action to drink this potion grants the drinker the potion's High.
When the High effect ends, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effects of the potion's Low.

entries.name: High.
entries: You gain an extra attack each turn for one minute.

At the start of each of your turns while affected by the potion, you must move to the nearest creature and use your action to attack it if you can. You may make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw to resist this.

entries.name: Low.
entries: You have disadvantage on Charisma and Wisdom checks and saving throws for one week. You feel rash, angry, and you struggle to put your feelings into words.
The effects of this potion's Low can be ended early through the spells {@spell Greater Restoration}, {@spell Heal}, or {@spell Wish}.

entries.name: Crafting Berserk.
entries: Crafting one bottle of Berserk requires

items.name: Tools.
entries: You must have proficiency in Alchemist's Supplies.

items.name: Materials.
entries: 10,000 GP of alchemical ingredients and 3 oz. of the dried and powdered amygdala of {@creature the angry|MTF}.

items.name: Time.
entries: 10 workweeks.

item.name: Brainbright
entries: A lightning blue liquid sloshes in this bottle. It fizzes gently when you move it and smells strongly of citrus.
Using an action to drink this potion grants the drinker the potion's High. When the High effect ends, you must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw to avoid the effects of the potion's Low.

entries.name: High.
entries: Your Intelligence score is increased by 4 for 1 hour. It can exceed 20 for the duration.

entries.name: Low.
entries: Currently unknown.

entries.name: Crafting Brainbright.
entries: Crafting one bottle of Brainbright requires

items.name: Tools.
entries: You must have proficiency in Alchemist's Supplies.

items.name: Materials.
entries: 1,000 GP of alchemical ingredients and a quart of blood from a {@creature Mind Flayer}.

items.name: Time.
entries: 1 workweek.

item.name: Pill of Greater Restoration
entries: A small, circular, white pill with “EAT ME” carved into it.
Using an action to swallow this potion casts {@spell Greater Restoration} on the consumer.

entries.name: Crafting Brainbright.
entries: Crafting one Pill of Greater Restoration requires

items.name: Tools.
entries: You must have proficiency in Alchemist's Supplies.

items.name: Materials.
entries: 10,000 GP of alchemical ingredients and 10 lb. of macerated bone from a {@creature Dire Troll|MPMM}.

items.name: Time.
entries: 10 workweeks.

item.name: Potion of Prowess
entries: Drinking this potion gives you a temporary level up. For the next minute, you have access to whatever features, spells, and spell slots the next level in your class presents you, if there are any.
Your hit-point maximum, hit dice, ability scores, and feats are unaffected.

item.name: Shimmerscale Breastplate
entries: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of shimmering beech wood, much like the scales of a fish. The lining is wolf's fur. The scales seem to shift in the light as you move, leaving a mesmerising pattern.

entries.name: Evasion.
entries: For every 10ft you have moved this turn, your AC increases by 1. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.
For movement to count, it must cost you some of your movement speed.

entries.name: Soulbound.
entries: Once this item has been attuned to, the attunement cannot be ended unless the attuned creature is willing or dead. While attuned to the item, each time the attuned creature gains a level in the Cleric or Paladin classes, they may choose one from the following properties. This item gains the chosen property. No property can be chosen more than once.
All gained properties are lost if the creature becomes unattuned, unless it is the next creature to attune to the item.

items.name: Sheep in Wolf's Clothing.
entries: You have advantage on Charisma checks made to persuade or deceive, provided you are telling the truth.

items.name: Scales of Justice.
entries: As a reaction when you are hit with a melee weapon attack that deals damage to you, if the total attack roll was even, you take half the damage instead. Your attacker takes half as well.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all spent uses at dawn.

items.name: Fangs of Chaos.
entries: When you hit a target with a melee weapon attack and the total attack roll was odd, you may use a bonus action to swap places with any creature within 60 ft.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all spent uses at dawn.

items.name: Delilah's Restoration.
entries: You can use an action to cast the spell {@spell Greater Restoration} without material components. Doing so causes you to gain one point of exhaustion and removes all of your hair.
The hair grows back over the course of the week, once your hair grows back you can re-use this action. Either way, this ability cannot be used more than once per day.

item.name: Terpsichorean Girdle
entries: A belt of twisted strands of leather in a light and complex pattern.

entries.name: Dancer's Grace.
entries: All attacks of opportunity against you are made at disadvantage.

entries.name: Soulbound.
entries: Once this item has been attuned to, the attunement cannot be ended unless the attuned creature is willing or dead. While attuned to the item, each time the attuned creature gains a level in the Rogue or Bard classes, they may choose one from the following properties. This item gains the chosen property. No property can be chosen more than once.
All gained properties are lost if the creature becomes unattuned, unless it is the next creature to attune to the item.

items.name: Sprightly Leap.
entries: Once per turn, you can spend 5 ft. of movement to jump up to 15 ft. in a straight line.

items.name: Chaos Tango.
entries: When you roll for initiative, you may immediately move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

items.name: Mesmeric Motion.
entries: If you dance for 10 minutes in a mesmeric fashion, all who see the dance must make a Wisdom save, DC of 10 + your Charisma modifier, or be {@condition Charmed} by you for 1 hour.
The effect ends early for any target that takes damage, if you attack it, or if it witnesses you attacking or damaging any of its allies.
Creatures that spend the full hour charmed by you forget about you and up to five creatures of your choice when the effect ends, if you so choose. They do not notice that they have forgotten you.

items.name: Tap Out.
entries: You can use a bonus action to grapple a creature and move it without causing attacks of opportunity on yourself or reducing your movement speed. If the creature is unwilling, make a standard grapple check.

item.name: Lon Lon Glaive
entries: This glaive is built on an extra-long, extra-strong haft and yet, somehow, it is no heavier or more difficult to wield than its ordinary counterpart.

entries.name: Double-Reach.
entries: This weapon has a reach of 15 ft. instead of the usual 10 ft.

entries.name: Soulbound.
entries: Once this item has been attuned to, the attunement cannot be ended unless the attuned creature is willing or dead. While attuned to the item, each time the attuned creature gains a level in the Warlock or Fighter classes, they may choose one from the following properties. This item gains the chosen property. No property can be chosen more than once.
All gained properties are lost if the creature becomes unattuned, unless it is the next creature to attune to the item.

items.name: Cleave.
entries: When you reduce an enemy to zero hit points with a melee weapon attack with the glaive on your turn, you may apply any remaining damage to another enemy within your reach.

items.name: The Lon Gest Glaive.
entries: As an action you extend the glaive beyond its normal limits. Make a melee weapon attack against every creature in a 30 ft. line originating from you. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your profiency bonus and regain all spent uses at dawn.

items.name: 15 Foot Pole.
entries: You may vault with the Lon Lon Glaive, adding either 15 ft. to your horizontal jump or 10 ft. to your high jump, provided you move at least 10 ft. in a straight line beforehand.
Each foot moved costs one foot of movement.

items.name: All Around Sight.
entries: As an action you can see through the Lon Lon Glaive's blade. You can see in all directions at once. This effect lasts for one minute. During this minute you cannot be surprised, however you cannot avert your eyes while this is active. You can end the effect whenever you want. This feature can be used once per short rest.

item.name: The Fractal Armament
entries: A crystal of bismuth constantly in flux between myriad weapon forms.

entries.name: Endless Possibility.
entries: Your initiative roll (ignoring modifiers) determines the type of weapon this blade becomes until the next time you roll initiative. You are always proficient in this weapon’s form and it does not require ammunition, although you must obey the Loading property if it has one.
If any spells or features require you to wield a specific weapon type, you may use them with the Fractal Armament, no matter what type of weapon it is.

entries.name: Soulbound.
entries: Once this item has been attuned to, the attunement cannot be ended unless the attuned creature is willing or dead. While attuned to the item, each time the attuned creature gains a level in the Bard or Ranger classes, they may choose one from the following properties. This item gains the chosen property. No property can be chosen more than once.
All gained properties are lost if the creature becomes unattuned, unless it is the next creature to attune to the item.

items.name: Enhanced Armoury.
entries: When you roll a 20 for your initiative roll, instead of a Vorpal blade, you may choose to roll 2 D20s and have both weapons rolled (extra 20s are Vorpal blades). The weapons gain the light property if they did not already have it and lose the two handed or heavy properties.

items.name: The Dead God's Favour
entries: When you kill a humanoid with this weapon, your next attack roll is made with advantage.

items.name: Flashing Trick.
entries: As a reaction, taken when a creature attacks an ally that you can see, you may spend one of your Bardic Inspiration die to attempt to distract the attacker. Add the number rolled for your Bardic Inspiration die to the target's AC until the attack is resolved.

items.name: Gaze Into Infinity.
entries: Once per long rest, when you roll to determine the form of your Fractal Armament, you may re roll one of the D20s once.

item.name: Dionysian Brooch
entries: A large claret ruby ensconced in delicate silver filigree. It smells sweetly of wine.

entries.name: Inured To Poison.
entries: You can still be {@condition Poisoned}, but do not suffer the effects of the {@condition Poisoned} condition or any effects of ingested poisons.

This means you do not gain the explicit disadvantage imposed by the {@condition Poisoned} condition, or any effects imposed by ingested poisons. You do still feel any effects beyond the {@condition Poisoned} condition from poisons that are not ingested, such as the knock out effect of Drow Poison tipped blades.

entries.name: Soulbound.
entries: Once this item has been attuned to, the attunement cannot be ended unless the attuned creature is willing or dead. While attuned to the item, each time the attuned creature gains a level in the Rogue or Sorcerer classes, they may choose one from the following properties. This item gains the chosen property. No property can be chosen more than once.
All gained properties are lost if the creature becomes unattuned, unless it is the next creature to attune to the item.

items.name: Prismatic Shield.
entries: As a reaction, a shimmering crystalline shield extends from the brooch, converting a critical hit into a normal hit. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, recovering all spent uses at dawn.

items.name: Double Vision.
entries: As a reaction, when you become {@condition Poisoned} condition, you may use the inebrious effects to create a mirror image of yourself next to you. While you have this mirror image, you gain the benefits of the {@spell Mirror Image} spell with only one copy.

When you are no longer {@condition Poisoned} or an attack destroys the image, the image disappears. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, recovering all spent uses at dawn.

items.name: Mesmeric Motion.
entries: If you were {@condition Poisoned} on the previous day, the crystal fills with a single dose of poison at dawn. The poison is an ingested poison that has the same effects as one of the poisons you were poisoned with. The brooch can be unstoppered and drunk or the contents can be laced in food or drink as an action.

items.name: Sharing Is Caring.
entries: While {@condition Poisoned}, you can use an action to spew a copy of the poison affecting you onto another creature. It acts as an inhaled poison for the purposes of determining whether a creature can be affected by it. Using this effect removes the poison from your system and you are no longer {@condition Poisoned}.

entries.name: Unstable.
entries: Anybody who tries to use this weapon without firearms proficiency must roll a D6. On a 1 or a 2, the weapon explodes, dealing {@dice 3d6} radiant damage to the wielder.

entries.name: Diminished item.
entries: Finding some way to create new ammunition for this weapon increases its tier to major.

entries.name: Unstable.
entries: Anybody who tries to use this weapon without firearms proficiency must roll a D6. On a 1 or a 2, the weapon explodes, dealing {@dice 3d6} radiant damage to the wielder.

entries.name: Diminished item.
entries: Finding some way to create new ammunition for this weapon increases its tier to major.

item.name: Pulse Cannon
entries: The Pulse Cannon starts with 4 charges. It does not regain charges.

As an action, you may expend any number of charges to fire a spread shot of superheated light in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} radiant damage per charge spent on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Firing the the Pulse Cannon has a X/6 chance of causing the weapon to explode, where X is the number of charges spent. The explosion deals {@damage 8d6} radiant damage to all creatures in a 20 foot radius sphere centered around the firer and destroys the Pulse Cannon.

entries.name: Unstable.
entries: Anybody who tries to use the Pulse Cannon without firearms proficiency causes the weapon to explode, dealing {@damage 8d6} radiant damage to all creatures in a 20 foot radius sphere centered around the firer and destroys the Pulse Cannon.

entries.name: Diminished item.
entries: Finding some way to recharge this item increases its tier to major.

variantrule.name: Identification
entries: Identifying magical properties is no easy task, but with dilligent effort - and a little experimentation - any mortal may discern the ineffable.

When you touch a magical item, you immediately know it's magical. There's a taste at the back of your mouth like copper, or blood, and your teeth tingle. You know not the properties, but you know for sure it's magical.

entries.name: Identifying magic items
entries: When you find a magical item, you immediately know that it's magic. The hair on the back of your neck stands on end and your skin tingles when you touch it.
The {@spell Identify} spell reveals all of its properties (except curses) as per usual.

As part of a short rest, you may spend the time investigating the item, perhaps examining minute marks and runes, combined with an Intelligence (History, Religion, or Arcana) check to learn information about it.

On a successful check, you learn the broad properties of it (e.g. that it is a folding boat, and that the command word is "exigent"), but you do not learn the item's full properties (e.g. remaining charges, any spells affecting it, or what spells created it).

Alternatively, you can experiment by using the item in the way you expect it to be used. If you get it right, then you learn that property! An example might be attempting to attune to a sword (you don't necessarily need to know that you have to attune to something to try) and if you feel an innate bond to it afterwards then, sure enough, it needed attunement. You could instead try using a wand on somebody to see what it does, or notice how the new axe you picked up seems to bite through armour a lot better than your last one...

entries.name: Identifying potions
entries: When you find a potion, the DM will describe it. Make notes! Each potion is unique in appearance and behaviour, although it is worth noting that some potions could be poisons disguised as other potions.
One exception to this is the {@item Potion of Healing}, which is so common that everybody knows what they look like.
You can determine the properties of any potion by drinking it in full, there are no half-chugs here!
Alternatively, you can spend a short rest examining it with alchemist's tools and an Intelligence (Alchemy Tools) check to see if you can identify it through its interactions with other chemicals.

entries.name: Identifying spell scrolls
entries: You instantly determine the spell inscribed on each spell scroll you find.

variantrule.name: Inspiration
entries: Inspiration can be used to re-roll one failed ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. It can be used after the result is declared, and even after the DM has told that you it fails.
When you take a long rest, you lose any inspiration you had.

variantrule.name: Travel Pace
entries: Each day, you have a number of travel tokens determined by your travel pace.
When you take a long rest, you lose any inspiration you had.

entries.name: Fast Pace
items: Perception checks are made at disadvantage.
Navigation checks are made at disadvantage.

entries: Each hex costs a number of tokens to enter, specified by terrain type. If you do not have enough tokens to enter the hex remaining, you must stop for the night. Subtract your remaining tokens from that hex’s cost and pay the rest in the morning.

entries.name: Tokens never carry over.
entries: At the start of each day, travel tokens are reset based on your travel pace.

entries.name: Increasing pace.
entries: If you increase your pace by one stage, for example from Slow pace to Normal Pace, or from Normal Pace to Fast Pace, you gain half your remaining tokens, rounded down.
If you increase your pace by two stages, by going from Slow Pace to Fast Pace, double your remaining tokens.

entries.name: Decreasing pace.
entries: If you decrease your pace by one stage by going from Fast Pace to Normal Pace or from Normal Pace to Slow Pace, subtract three tokens.
If you decrease your pace by two stages by going from Fast Pace to Slow Pace, subtract six tokens.

entries.name: Partial travel days.
entries: If the party begin travelling part-way through the day, work out the fraction of time remaining in the day to travel and multiply that fraction by the tokens gained from the initial travel pace the party have chosen, rounding down. To make this simpler, portion the day into thirds.

variantrule.name: Guild Maintenance
entries: The Guild Of Icons as it currently stands loses money at 10 gp per day. This money is automatically subtracted from the treasury (handled by your clerk) at the end of every workweek of downtime.
This price pays for standard maintenance and employment fees for 5 skilled hirelings and 3 untrained hirelings. The hireling makeup can be changed, but by default is:

entries.name: Skilled Hirelings
items: Two mercenaries, who perform security duty.
A trainer, who offers tool and weapon training.
Two diplomats, who secure new contracts.

entries.name: Unskilled Hirelings
items: A clerk, who manages the guild's accounts.
Two housekeepers, who clean the guild premises.

entries: You can add more hirelings at the usual cost for hirelings. You cannot reduce the number of hirelings below this level.
Note that none of this daily loss includes fees for adventurers, those come out of the jobs they take.

Working for the guild opens up a special downtime activity: Guild Work. Guild Work is spent in workweeks as usual. At the end of downtime, tally the total number of workweeks spent on Guild Work by all players, multiply by 5, and let the DM know. They'll then determine the guild's profit or losses.

row: Cantlore oversized foam gauntlet adorned with the Cantlore Glass Cannons logo
Flagon adorned with a fake eye
Joke diploma (School of Not Being As Smart As A Cleric)

entries: Once per turn when you deal slashing damage with this weapon, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or start bleeding for 1 minute. While bleeding, the target takes {@dice 1d8} slashing damage at the start of each of its turns.
A bleeding creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The effect is ended if the creature regains at least 5 hit points in one turn.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The squirrel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The squirrel's long jump is up to 10 ft. and its high jump is up to 5 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Brass Cannon is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Brass Cannon can cast the following spells: Cantrips (at will): Message

trait.name: Brass Cannon
entries: The Brass Cannon is immune to the Poisoned condition.

action.name: Thunderclap
entries: The Brass Cannon creates a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature within 5 ft. of the Brass Cannon, other than himself, must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Signature Move: Cacophony (Recharge 4-6)
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from the Brass Cannon must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and is pushed up to 15 feet away from the Brass Cannon. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Brass Cannon is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Brass Cannon can cast the following spells: Cantrips (at will): Prestidigitation

trait.name: Brass Cannon
entries: The Brass Cannon is immune to the Poisoned condition.

action.name: Thunderclap
entries: The Brass Cannon creates a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature within 5 ft. of the Brass Cannon, other than himself, must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Signature Move: Countercharm (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The Brass Cannon uses musical notes or words of power to disrupt mind-influencing effects. As an action, he can start a performance that lasts until the end of his next turn. During that time, he and any friendly creatures within 30 feet of him have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}. A creature must be able to hear the Brass Cannon to gain this benefit. The performance ends early if he is {@condition incapacitated} or silenced or if he voluntarily ends it (no action required).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Brass Cannon is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Brass Cannon can cast the following spells: Cantrips (at will): Dancing Lights

trait.name: Brass Cannon
entries: The Brass Cannon is immune to the Poisoned condition.

action.name: Thunderclap
entries: The Brass Cannon creates a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature within 5 ft. of the Brass Cannon, other than himself, must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Signature Move: Stratocaster (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The Brass Cannon teleports himself and up to one willing creature to an unoccupied space he can see within range. Immediately after he disappears, a thunderous boom sounds, and each creature within 10 feet of the space he left must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The thunder can be heard from up to 300 feet away.

When the Brass Cannon teleports with a willing creature, the creature must be within 5 feet of him when he casts this spell, and there must be an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your destination space for the creature to appear in; otherwise, the creature is left behind.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: Vintage has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: Vintage's attack rolls score a critical hit on a 19 or 20 on the d20.

action.name: Attac
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. This attack crits on a natural 19 or natural 20.

bonus.name: Pant
entries: Vintage can use a Second Wind to regain {@dice 1d10 + 2} hit points. Only one Second Wind can be used per short or long rest.

reaction.name: Protecc
entries: Vintage can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll of a creature within 5 feet of it whose target isn't Vintage, provided Vintage can see the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Cedric casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13})

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage.

Cedric is a trainee, Rincewind-like wizard. Not very good at magic. Nervous. Lawful neutral.He joins Haze for a second time after she approaches him to join them on a dragon hunting quest - he’s very nervous though and only agrees because she lets him in on some secrets and gives him a clockwork amulet.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells. Apprentices are novice arcane spellcasters who serve more experienced wizards or attend school. They perform menial work like cooking or cleaning in exchange for education in the ways of magic.

trait.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your elf blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Brass Cannon is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Brass Cannon can cast the following spells: Cantrips (at will): Blade Ward

trait.name: Brass Cannon
entries: The Brass Cannon is immune to the Poisoned condition.

action.name: Thunderclap
entries: The Brass Cannon creates a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature within 5 ft. of the Brass Cannon, other than himself, must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Signature Move: 4'33 (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The Brass Cannon emits the opposite of noise. All creatures within 20 ft. of the Brass Cannon are Silenced as if with the {@spell Silence} spell until the end of the Brass Cannon's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Brass Cannon is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The Brass Cannon can cast the following spells: Cantrips (at will): Minor Illusion

trait.name: Brass Cannon
entries: The Brass Cannon is immune to the Poisoned condition.

action.name: Thunderclap
entries: The Brass Cannon creates a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature within 5 ft. of the Brass Cannon, other than himself, must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Signature Move: Conduction (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The Brass Cannon creates a dancing musical note that hovers around a target creature's head. Immediately after the creature rolls their next attack roll against a target, the mote shatters in crackling thunder and lightning. The target of the original attack and each creature of the Brass Cannon's choice that the Brass Cannon can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or 4 ({@dice 1d8}) thunder and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage.
